definition: Elvis Presley (1935-1977), US pop singer and film star/transliterated as 埃爾維斯·普雷斯利|埃尔维斯·普雷斯利[Ai1 er3 wei2 si1 · Pu3 lei2 si1 li4]
cat/CL:隻|只[zhi1]/(dialect) to hide oneself/(coll.) modem
king or monarch/best or strongest of its type/grand/great

sentences.english: You see tons of Elvis or Marilyn Monroe impersonators all the time.
sentences.chinese: 你隨時都能見到一堆模仿貓王和夢露的人。

sentences.english: They were married three and a half years ago by an Elvis impersonator in Las Vegas.
sentences.chinese: 他們三年半前在拉斯維加斯的貓王模仿秀上結婚。

sentences.english: Want to walk a mile in Elvis Presley’s blue suede shoes?
sentences.chinese: 想穿上貓王的藍色皮靴走走？

sentences.english: From Elvis-inspired jumpsuits to locks of celebrity hair, it's all out there, and it's all for sale.
sentences.chinese: 從貓王演出套裝到名人的頭髮，都在那裏，都有出售。

sentences.english: Some people have compared him to Elvis.
sentences.chinese: 有些人把他比作“貓王”埃爾維斯。

sentences.english: King Totoro is the mascot for Miyazaki's studio, Studio Ghibli.
sentences.chinese: 龍貓王是宮崎市吉卜力動畫工作室的吉祥物。

sentences.english: So, Elvis Presley has a Bacon number of two.
Call off the Elvis impersonator and cancel the trip to Vegas.
sentences.chinese: 取消貓王的演員並取消其去維加斯。

sentences.english: He'd also stay up meowing for hours some nights, and we'd call it his 'Elvis croon.
sentences.chinese: 他還保持喵喵叫幾個小時，我們會叫他’貓王輕哼。

definition: The Sound of Music, Broadway musical (1959) and Academy Award-winning movie (1965)
to have a unique style of one's own (idiom)
unplugged (of rock musicians performing on acoustic instruments)
